abstract: The debt-laden miner Rio Tinto may try to persuade irate shareholders to back a $19.5 billion tie-up with Chinalco by offering them bonds on the same terms as the Chinese company, The Sydney Morning Herald Reported.
lead_paragraph: The debt-laden miner Rio Tinto may try to persuade irate shareholders to back a $19.5 billion tie-up with Chinalco by offering them bonds on the same terms as the Chinese company, The Sydney Morning Herald Reported.

headline.main: Rio May Offer Notes to All Shareholders, Report Says
